# Draft:Edward Hale Brush

Edward Hale Brush (October 6, 1865-?) was an author and lecturer in the United States. He was the son of a Reverend ans his brother George Robert Brush was a Reverend and the author of St. James Parish Arlington, Vermont and the Diocese of Vermont published in 1941 and A Companion to the Prayer Book published in 1951.
He wrote an article about art and artists on Long Island, New York.
columnist?
He was an 1887 graduate of Columbia University.
He reviewed the Pan-American Exposition.
Several articles he wrote were published in Scientific American.
Writings
*Iroquois Past And Present, with brief sketches of Redjacket, Cornplanter, and Mary Jemison by Edward Dinwoodie Strickland, Buffalo (1901)
*Rufus King and His Times'' New York (1926)
Articles
*"American History and Mural Painting"
*"The Art of Isidore Konti-Sculptor"
*"The Makers of Statuary"
